hints.content: For $\dfrac28$ and $\dfrac14$ to be equivalent, they must be fractions of  the same size whole.
Which image shows $\dfrac28$ and $\dfrac14$ represented on the same size whole?

options.alt: Two squares that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the squares. The top square is divided into 8 equal parts. Two of the parts are shaded. The bottom square is divided into 4 equal parts. One of the parts is shaded. !

Two squares that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the squares. The top square is divided into 8 equal parts. Two of the parts are shaded. The bottom square is divided into 4 equal parts. One of the parts is shaded. !

choices.content: ![Two squares that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the squares. The top square is divided into 8 equal parts. Two of the parts are shaded. The bottom square is divided into 4 equal parts. One of the parts is shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e2fc3fee328a21f109b47f121f8e155588f56536)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/28f55923ba36a90ae94e16b78291559db53fbb99)

![Two diamonds that are different sizes. There is an equal sign between the diamonds. The top diamond is small. It is divided into 8 equal parts. Two of the parts are shaded. The bottom diamond is big. It is divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6d91ff49d0e78997806ece3739b650e995a79adc)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e165fbca536e0a05552d2ac8694395be56eed20e)

![A square and a rectangle. The rectangle is larger than the square. There is an equal sign between the two shapes. The rectangle is divided into 8 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The square is divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0e3bf00c6a930d4a2e68bf901665d5d155fc3ed)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fb049f877be8119c69cf28a9d1f04e2eac69a4f2)
